document_data.name: Yuminoi Bowida
document_data.mainbody: '''Yuminoi Bowida''' was a [[Roju]] representative in [[Fochu]] in [[Wa]] around [[1357 DR]].
document_data.Activities: Bowida was sent from [[Uwaji]] by the Roju in Fochu to survey possible activity of followers of [[Chauntea]] in the area since daimyo [[Bokika Hokio]] was known to sympathized for them. Bowida love his job, especially possibility to execute suspect peasants taking advantage of his [[kirsute gome]] privilege. Often he manufactured evidence against people. All in the area hated Yuminoi and his men.
